cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi (175 km) W of the Dry Tortugas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, then north toward the Florida Panhandle / Alabama coast and inland through Alabama and the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Florida Panhandle–Alabama border
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system will not move offshore of the Great Lakes region)
cyclone.hours_of_strike: N/A (no direct strike expected at Cleveland-Cuyahoga Port, OH)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL (northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: BIRMINGHAM AL (closest location listed in the wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-cyclone-related winds expected at the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for light to moderate remnant rainfall mid-week, amounts likely well below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated from Fred at Cleveland-Cuyahoga Port, OH
